security_audit.summary: Legitimate PDF processing toolkit with standard libraries. Accesses PDF files for reading/writing as documented. Contains helper scripts for form filling and validation. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Extract text and tables from PDFs
content.value_statement: Processing PDF documents manually takes too much time. This toolkit provides comprehensive PDF operations including text extraction, table detection, form filling, and document creation using Python and command-line tools.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF documents using pdfplumber
Merge multiple PDFs or split documents into individual pages
Fill PDF forms programmatically with fillable fields or annotations
Convert PDF pages to images for visual analysis
Create new PDFs with text, tables, and styling using reportlab
Extract metadata, rotate pages, add watermarks, and password-protect documents
limitations: Scanned PDFs require OCR tools like pytesseract for text extraction
Complex forms without fillable fields require visual bounding box analysis
Some PDF viewers may not display annotations consistently
Large PDFs may require chunked processing for memory efficiency

best_practices: Use pdfplumber for text with coordinates when you need to preserve layout information
Validate form field coordinates using the bounding box checker before filling
Process large PDFs in chunks to manage memory usage effectively
anti_patterns: Do not use OCR for digitally-created PDFs when text extraction is available
Do not skip validation of bounding boxes when filling non-fillable forms
Do not attempt to fill encrypted PDFs without the correct password

faq.question: Which library should I use for text extraction?
faq.answer: Use pdfplumber for text with layout preservation and table extraction. Use pypdf for basic operations like merging and splitting.

faq.question: How do I handle scanned PDFs without text?
faq.answer: Convert the PDF to images using pdf2image, then use pytesseract for OCR-based text extraction.

faq.question: Can I use this with JavaScript or Node.js?
faq.answer: Yes, use pdf-lib for browser and Node.js environments. See REFERENCE.md for examples.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally. No data is sent to external servers. PDFs are only read from and written to paths you specify.

faq.question: Why are my form annotations not visible?
faq.answer: Some PDF viewers do not display FreeText annotations consistently. Try opening the output in a different viewer like Adobe Acrobat.

faq.question: How is this different from pdf-lib?
faq.answer: This toolkit focuses on Python-based processing with pypdf and pdfplumber. pdf-lib is a JavaScript library for browser and Node.js use.
